String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: But tonight is a cause for celebration! I will toast you and sing your praise, one gentleman to another. The night is still a maiden yet!
String.Dest: But tonight is a cause for celebration! I will toast you and sing your praise, one gentleman to another. The night is still a maiden yet!

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: I knew you would. You and I are both of cultured, civilized people, who value the arts as much as we value the sword.
String.Dest: 我就知道你会的。你和我都是高端大气上档次的人，我们重视艺术就想我们重视我们的剑一样。

String.Source: A poem worthy of you requires time. It will take ten, no, twenty years to compose. I will begin penning it on the morrow.
String.Dest: 一首好诗是值得你花时间去雕琢的。 创作一首好诗要花十年，不，二十年的时间。 我准备明天开始动笔。

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: But tonight is a cause for celebration! Join me at the Skeever for a drink! I will toast you and sing your praise, a gentleman to a lady.
String.Dest: 但今晚是一个值得庆贺的一晚！和我在眨眼雪鼠里喝上一杯！我会给你敬酒并对你大唱赞歌，正如一个绅士对女士所做的那样。

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: I knew you would. You and I are both of cultured, civilized people, who value the arts as much as we value the sword.
String.Dest: 我就知道你会的。你和我都是高端大气上档次的人，我们重视艺术就想我们重视我们的剑一样。

String.Source: A poem worthy of you requires time. It will take ten, no, twenty years to complete. I will begin penning it on the morrow.
String.Dest: 一首值得一阅的诗需要时间。这将花费十年，不，二十年的时间去完成。我明天开始写。

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: I would be honored to hear this poem.
String.Dest: 聆听这首诗歌将是我的荣幸！

String.Source: But tonight is a cause for celebration! I will toast you and sing your praise, a gentleman to a lady. The night is still a maiden yet!
String.Dest: 但是今晚我们要尽情庆祝！我会向你敬酒和歌颂赞美，如同绅士向淑女般。待此夜如同处子！

String.Source: (Laughs) So do I, traveler, so do I. Let us make the night whatever we want it to be, for the Nord is no longer alive to spoil it!
String.Dest: (笑声)我也是旅行者，我也是。让我们制造黑夜吧，对于死了的诺德人来说他们就在也没法去糟蹋它了。

String.Source: Can the night be a handsome gentleman? I prefer those.
String.Dest: 晚上能变成一个英俊的绅士吗？我更喜欢那样？

String.Source: You aren't applauding. No, applause is meant for halfwit apprentices who fancy themselves masters.
String.Dest: 你没有鼓掌。没有，鼓掌应该是用来给那些自以为超神了的半吊子学生的。

String.Source: (Remain silent.)
String.Dest: (保持沉默.)

String.Source: Yet my poetry reaches an entirely new level of appreciation. Utter and unequivocal shock at having my poetic brandy poured down your ears.
String.Dest: 如今我的诗歌已能到了一个更高的理解水平 ，严谨和杂乱的韵脚使你的耳朵能如同痛饮甘冽美酒般的刺激的感受。.

String.Source: (Remain silent.)
String.Dest: (保持沉默.)

String.Source: Don't worry, you need not say a word. Nothing you say will suffice. The expression on your face tells it all.
String.Dest: 别担心，你不需要说话。即便什么都不说也已经足够。因为你脸上的表情已经透露了一切。

String.Source: (Remain silent.)
String.Dest: (保持沉默.)

String.Source: So alas, it's left up to a perfect mind to put it into words. The poem is about how caves are a home, for the undead whose winter never comes.
String.Dest: 啊哈，剩下的就是由一个聪明的灵魂来把它组织成文字。这首诗是说，对于那些冬日从未降到他们头上的不死的生灵来说，洞穴，就是家。。。

String.Source: (Remain silent.)
String.Dest: (保持沉默.)

String.Source: I've resided here at the Bards College for nearly all my life, although my first true epiphany came outside it.
String.Dest: 吟游诗人学院几乎耗尽了我的一生，虽然我第一次真正的顿悟是在离开它之后。

String.Source: How long have you studied at the college?
String.Dest: 你在学院学了多久了？

String.Source: I was visiting my father for the summer. Circumstances had forced him to live in a slatternly cave, as society refused to grant him his nobility.
String.Dest: 夏天的时候我去看望了我的父亲。社会不愿授予他名分，这样的环境使然，他不得不居住在一座破败的山洞里。

String.Source: How long have you studied at the college?
String.Dest: 你在学院学了多久了？

String.Source: I begged him to return to Solitude with me, to hide in the light, but the old man refused. The caves were his home.
String.Dest: 我恳请他跟我回独孤城, 并隐藏起来, 但老人拒绝了. 山洞就是他的家.

String.Source: How long have you studied at the college?
String.Dest: 你在学院学了多久了？

String.Source: Only to him, they weren't caves. They were grand theaters. Sounds echoed off the rock. Wind serenaded us through the open slats in the roof.
String.Dest: 可对于他而言，那些都不是洞穴。而是大剧院。声音回荡在石壁之间。风在穿过屋顶岩缝时为我们唱歌。

String.Source: How long have you studied at the college?
String.Dest: 你在学院学了多久了？

String.Source: He said its music gave more warmth than any of these structures of mortar and stone can ever attest to. It was actually freezing, but I understood.
String.Dest: 他说，音乐比任何石沙构成的建筑更能给人以温暖。那些其实的冷的，但我明白他的意思。

String.Source: How long have you studied at the college?
String.Dest: 你在学院学了多久了？

String.Source: A fine and bloody tale, and I do enjoy blood.
String.Dest: 一个美丽又凄惨的故事。我喜欢。

String.Source: Ragnar the Red.
String.Dest: 红衣拉格纳。

String.Source: A lucky guess, no doubt. Evidently the brute didn't make the same assessment of you.
String.Dest: 无疑你赌对了，很显然那个蛮子就不如你估计准确。

String.Source: That's funny, because he thought you were a vampire.
String.Dest: 太滑稽了，因为他还以为你是个吸血鬼呢。

String.Source: Clearly he's throwing spit to the wind and hoping it hits something other than his face.
String.Dest: 显然他打算把唾沫吐到风中然后希望它落在别处除了自己的脸上。

String.Source: That's funny, because he thought you were a vampire.
String.Dest: 太滑稽了，因为他还以为你是个吸血鬼呢。

String.Source: That's funny, because he thought you were a vampire.
String.Dest: 太滑稽了，因为他还以为你是个吸血鬼呢。

String.Source: Coming from him, I'll take that as a compliment. Clearly he's throwing spit to the wind and hoping it hits something other than his face.
String.Dest: 从他嘴里说出来，我会把那当成褒奖。显然他打算把唾沫吐到风中然后希望它落在别处除了自己的脸上。

String.Source: You think he's a werewolf. Maybe he thinks you're a vampire.
String.Dest: 你认为他是狼人？也许他还觉得你是吸血鬼呢。

String.Source: Coming from him, I'll take that as a compliment. Clearly he's throwing spit to the wind and hoping it hits something other than his face.
String.Dest: 从他嘴里说出来，我会把那当成褒奖。显然他打算把唾沫吐到风中然后希望它落在别处除了自己的脸上。

String.Source: Or the taste of vengeance. The Jarl and her traitorous court wizard, Sybille Stentor, have hunted the caverns of Haafinger for years.
String.Dest: 这就是复仇的滋味。 领主和她那些巫师叛徒, Sybille Stentor，已经在海芬加领的洞穴阴魂不散好多年了.

String.Source: You're right. Maybe it's the status, but Jarls do look plump and delicious.
String.Dest: 你说的对。或许情况就是这样，但领主们看起来真的很鲜肥美味。

String.Source: You're right. Maybe it's the status, but Jarls do look plump and delicious.
String.Dest: 你说的对。或许情况就是这样，但领主们看起来真的很鲜肥美味。

String.Source: It's only through the genius of our lineage that my father has managed to escape the witch's claws for this long.
String.Dest: 很久之后，通过我们血统遗传的天赋力量，我的父亲设法逃离了女巫的魔爪。

String.Source: Although I worry there is not a cave left in Haafinger that the court wizard has not turned her eye upon.
String.Dest: 虽然我担心要是海芬加领一个山洞都没留下的话，那个宫廷巫师就没有能转移注意的东西了。

String.Source: You're right. Maybe it's the status, but Jarls do look plump and delicious.
String.Dest: 你说的对。或许情况就是这样，但领主们看起来真的很鲜肥美味。

String.Source: That is why I have sent my servant to find my father and force him to return him to Solitude.
String.Dest: 这就是为什么我让我的随从去找我爸而且逼他回独孤城.

String.Source: You're right. Maybe it's the status, but Jarls do look plump and delicious.
String.Dest: 你说的对。或许情况就是这样，但领主们看起来真的很鲜肥美味。

String.Source: Tale of the Tongues.
String.Dest: 【歌名待校对】龙语传奇。

String.Source: An excellent request. This one is for the Dragonborn, a true lady for the ages.
String.Dest: 一个很好的要求。这个人是龙裔，在这个时代中的一位真正的淑女。

String.Source: Tale of the Tongues.
String.Dest: 【歌名待校对】龙语传奇。

String.Source: An excellent request. This one is for the Dragonborn, a true gentleman for the ages.
String.Dest: 一个很好的要求。这个人是龙裔, 在这个时代中的一位真正的绅士。

String.Source: That poem was personal. I think you're a vampire. Takes one to know one.
String.Dest: 那首诗是我个人的。 我认为你是个吸血鬼，我们是同胞。

String.Source: So you too enjoy a good drink with a good poem! I knew there was something keen about you the moment we met.
String.Dest: 所以你也尽情享受美酒和诗歌吧！当我们见面的时候我就知道有些东西是你所喜爱的。

String.Source: I tell these fools I have a "hereditary affliction." Ha! An entire school of bards, and they know not the first thing about irony!
String.Dest: I我告诉那些傻逼我可是有“世袭的苦难。”的男人哈！那些学院全部的游吟诗人，他们知道讽刺不是首要之事。

String.Source: That poem was personal. I think you're a vampire. Takes one to know one.
String.Dest: 那首诗是我个人的。 我认为你是个吸血鬼，我们是同胞。

String.Source: Yes, the poem was personal. It is unfortunate that those who have achieved a higher plane of existence are forced to call caves home.
String.Dest: 是的，这首诗是个人的。不幸的是那些已经达到存在于更高面位的家伙却被强迫叫到山顶洞人那里。

String.Source: That poem was personal. I think you're a vampire. Takes one to know one.
String.Dest: 那首诗是我个人的。 我认为你是个吸血鬼，我们是同胞。

String.Source: It is this dissonance that allows men like the Nord to insult my heritage, when in truth he should envy it.
String.Dest: It is this dissonance that allows men like the Nord to insult my heritage, when in truth he should envy it.

String.Source: That poem was personal. I think you're a vampire. Takes one to know one.
String.Dest: 那首诗是我个人的。 我认为你是个吸血鬼，我们是同胞。

String.Source: Yes, because I am the type of backwards skooma addict who would ignore the fine beds that have at the college for damp, mold infested cave.
String.Dest: 没错，因为我对斯库玛上瘾严重。如果没有斯库玛，即使在学院舒适的床上，也比不上潮湿，发霉，野兽横行的山洞。

String.Source: That poem was personal. I bet you live in a cave, you homeless beggar.
String.Dest: 这是我的诗。 我敢打赌你住在山洞里, 你这无家可归的乞丐.

String.Source: But you're right. It was personal. I honor my father, a great man of noble birth, forced to live like an ice wolf.
String.Dest: 但你是对的。这有着私人原因。我尊敬我的父亲，他是个贵族出身的伟人，却被迫如冰狼一般的生活。

String.Source: That poem was personal. I bet you live in a cave, you homeless beggar.
String.Dest: 这是我的诗。 我敢打赌你住在山洞里, 你这无家可归的乞丐.

String.Source: It is with great pride that I inherited his countenance, and I will wear it smiling when I restore his honor and mine by vanquishing the Nord.
String.Dest: 我继承了他的面容，这是个极大的骄傲。当我恢复他的名誉，亦或是亲自战胜那个诺德人之时，我会用那张脸来微笑。

String.Source: That poem was personal. I bet you live in a cave, you homeless beggar.
String.Dest: 这是我的诗。 我敢打赌你住在山洞里, 你这无家可归的乞丐.

String.Source: Oh, but my verse will worm its way into his mind like a poison, gnawing away at the tips until it burrows a hole to the heart of madness.
String.Dest: 仇视？当然，我仇视所有胆敢玷污我的荣耀的人，哪怕是个小丑，我也会狠狠地责备他。

String.Source: If that's the case, your poetry won't mean anything to him.
String.Dest: 如果是那种情况的话，你的诗歌对他来说将没有任何意义。

String.Source: It is not death I speak of, but the death of his dream. I will make him weep until the widows pity his soul. And then I will kill him. But only then.
String.Dest: 我所说的不是死亡, 而是指他梦想的终结. 在寡妇怜悯他的灵魂前我会让他一直流泪. 到那时候我会杀死他. 但只有到那时候才行.

String.Source: If that's the case, your poetry won't mean anything to him.
String.Dest: 如果是那种情况的话，你的诗歌对他来说将没有任何意义。

String.Source: My verse will worm its way into his mind like a poison, gnawing away at the tips until it burrows a hole to the heart of madness.
String.Dest: 我的诗韵会想毒液一般渗进他的思想，一点点蛀空他，直到在他的疯狂之心上打个洞。

String.Source: How will a poetry duel be any different?
String.Dest: 一个诗歌决斗会有什么不同呢？

String.Source: No, what I speak of now is not the death of the Nord, but the death of his dream. And then I'll kill him.
String.Dest: 不，我想说的不是这个诺德人的死，而是他梦想的真正死去。在此之后，我结束了他的生命。

String.Source: How will a poetry duel be any different?
String.Dest: 一个诗歌决斗会有什么不同呢？

String.Source: Animosity? Of course I hold animosity for one who continues to befoul my honor, and do so in a fashion that even a coward would find reproachful.
String.Dest: 憎恨？当然我对那个有辱我荣耀的人依旧怀恨在心，这么就像是非难别人是一个懦夫。

String.Source: You have a lot of animosity considering you don't even know how this started.
String.Dest: 你对之恨之入骨，却不知这份仇恨是因何而起。

String.Source: I've challenged him to many duels as he has fleas. While I'm a gentleman, I won't let this cur's crimes go unpunished.
String.Dest: 我曾数次向他发起决斗，而他悉数逃走。我是一位绅士，但我绝不能姑息这无赖的罪行。

String.Source: You have a lot of animosity considering you don't even know how this started.
String.Dest: 你对之恨之入骨，却不知这份仇恨是因何而起。

String.Source: You have a lot of animosity considering you don't even know how this started.
String.Dest: 你对之恨之入骨，却不知这份仇恨是因何而起。

String.Source: Yet with every duel he has bribed, cheated, lied, and stolen to ensure his survival. Now he simply opts to flee.
String.Dest: 每场决斗他都在靠贿赂，作弊，说谎，偷窃这些来确保自己的生存。现在他无非选择了逃离罢了。

String.Source: Oh, but my verse will worm its way into his mind like a poison, gnawing away at the tips until it burrows a hole to the heart of madness.
String.Dest: 仇视？当然，我仇视所有胆敢玷污我的荣耀的人，哪怕是个小丑，我也会狠狠地责备他。

String.Source: You have a lot of animosity considering you don't even know how this started.
String.Dest: 你对之恨之入骨，却不知这份仇恨是因何而起。

String.Source: It is not death I speak of, but the death of his dream. I will make him weep until the widows pity his soul. And then I will kill him. But only then.
String.Dest: 我所说的不是死亡, 而是指他梦想的终结. 在寡妇怜悯他的灵魂前我会让他一直流泪. 到那时候我会杀死他. 但只有到那时候才行.

String.Source: You have a lot of animosity considering you don't even know how this started.
String.Dest: 你对之恨之入骨，却不知这份仇恨是因何而起。

String.Source: Your insight is to be commended. I did indeed do as you suggested, as I'd suspected that only Hircine could manifest such a soiled existence.
String.Dest: 您的见识真是卓越。我按照你说的去做了，因为我怀疑只有海尔辛才能创造出这么肮脏的生物。

String.Source: If he was a werewolf, you might consider joining the Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 如果他是只狼人，那你应该考虑加入银手。

String.Source: Unfortunately, while the Silver Hand provided me with valuable leads, they wouldn't agree to allowing me to duel the fiend myself.
String.Dest: 不幸的是，虽然银手给我提供了宝贵的线索，但是他们不会同意让我自己对付恶魔。

String.Source: If he was a werewolf, you might consider joining the Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 如果他是只狼人，那你应该考虑加入银手。

String.Source: If he was a werewolf, you might consider joining the Silver Hand.
String.Dest: 如果他是只狼人，那你应该考虑加入银手。

String.Source: The unruly fools only wanted to sate their bloodlust, and as far as I'm concerned were as disgraceful as the werewolves they hunted.
String.Dest: 这群不守规矩的白痴只想满足他们的杀戮欲, 他们就像他们猎杀的那些狼人一样丑陋。

String.Source: Skjarn said you joined the Silver Hand to hunt him.
String.Dest: 史卡盎 说你加入了白银之手来狩猎他。

String.Source: No doubt the swamp drake thought I allied myself with the hunters in order to gain an advantage in our duel. Far from it.
String.Dest: 毫无疑问，那些沼泽生物觉得我和猎人们结盟是想在战斗中渔利。差远了。

String.Source: Unfortunately, while the Silver Hand provided me with valuable leads, they wouldn't agree to allowing me to duel the fiend myself.
String.Dest: 不幸的是，虽然银手给我提供了宝贵的线索，但是他们不会同意让我自己对付恶魔。

String.Source: Skjarn said you joined the Silver Hand to hunt him.
String.Dest: 史卡盎 说你加入了白银之手来狩猎他。

String.Source: The unruly fools only wanted to sate their bloodlust, and as far as I'm concerned were as disgraceful as the werewolves they hunted.
String.Dest: 这群不守规矩的白痴只想满足他们的杀戮欲, 他们就像他们猎杀的那些狼人一样丑陋。

String.Source: Skjarn said you joined the Silver Hand to hunt him.
String.Dest: 史卡盎 说你加入了白银之手来狩猎他。

String.Source: Snow falls on all the land, all the land, all the land, snow falls on all the land, shrouded by dark wings.
String.Dest: 雪覆大地，雪覆大地，白雪覆盖一切，再由黑翼披上寿衣。

String.Source: A child prayed unto the Gods, save the land, save the land, and the Gods said unto the child, to Skyrim comes spring.
String.Dest: 孺子向神明祷告，求您救救这块土地吧，救救这块土地吧，神明对孩子说，天际之春已踏步而来。

String.Source: For a hero does walk the land, walk the land, walk the land, a hero does walk the land, and the dragons will flee.
String.Dest: 当一个英雄在路上，在路上，在路上，一个英雄在路上，龙就逃跑咯。

String.Source: Flowers bloom on the land, children walk hand in hand, sun shining on white sand, to Skyrim comes peace.
String.Dest: 鲜花盛开在这片土地，孩子们手牵手走在路上，太阳照耀着白色的沙滩，天际迎来了和平。

String.Source: Alduin's wings they did darken the sky; His roar fury's fire and his scales sharpened scythes;
String.Dest: 奥杜因其翼遮天蔽日，其吼怒焰四溢，其鳞利如刀锋。

String.Source: Men ran and they cowered and they fought and they died; They burned and they bled as they issued their cries;
String.Dest: 人类退缩、逃跑，战斗、死亡。人类受伤、流血，痛哭、哀嚎。

String.Source: We need saviors to free us from Alduin's rage; Heroes on the field of this new war to wage;
String.Dest: 我们需要救世主将我们从奥杜因的愤怒中解放。这片大地上的英雄们要踏入新的战场上。

String.Source: And if Alduin wins, men is gone from this world; Lost in the shadows of the black wings unfurled;
String.Dest: 奥杜因的胜利，将带来人类的灭亡，黑色双翼的阴影下无处可藏。

String.Source: But then came the Tongues on that terrible day; Steadfast as winter they entered the fray;
String.Dest: 可怕的岁月里，发声者们加入战斗，踏着坚定的步伐，凯歌高奏。

String.Source: And all heard the music of Alduin's doom; The sweet song of Skyrim, sky-shattering Thu'um;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】奥杜因拉下了的命运之幕，那是天际的赞歌，是响彻天际的吐目。

String.Source: And so the Tongues freed us from Alduin's rage; Gave the gift of the Voice, ushered in a new age;
String.Dest: 发声者从奥杜因的愤怒之中解救了我们，龙吼的天赐，引领我们进入新的时代。

String.Source: If Alduin's eternal then eternity's done; For his story is over and the dragons are gone.
String.Dest: 奥杜因的永恒，已然不在。奥杜因的故事，已经终结。龙也消失于天外。

String.Source: Our hero, our hero, claims a warrior's heart! I tell you, I tell you, the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】英雄，英雄，勇者无惧。我告诉你，我告诉你，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: With a Voice wielding power of the ancient Nord art; Believe, believe the Dragornborn comes;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】诺德技艺，龙吼回归。没错，没错，他是龙裔。

String.Source: It's an end to the evil, of all Skyrim's foes; Beware, beware the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 终结邪恶，敌人的末日。当心，当心，龙裔出世。

String.Source: For the darkness has passed and the legend yet grows; You'll know, you'll know the Dragonborn comes.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】黑暗消逝，传奇之曲正在编织。你会发现，你会发现，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: We drink to our youth, and to days come and gone. For the Age of Aggression is now nearly done.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】为青春干杯，为那些逝去的和将来的日子干杯。因为好战的年代已经结束。

String.Source: We'll drive out the Stormcloaks and restore what we own. With our blood and our steel we will take back our home.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】我们将驱逐风暴斗篷并恢复我们拥有的一切。用我们的鲜血和武器夺回家园。

String.Source: Down with Ulfric! The killer of kings! On the day of your death, we'll drink and we'll sing!
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】乌弗瑞克这跳梁小丑！是杀害至高王的凶手！当你终于被湮灭带走，我们会欢唱会喝酒！

String.Source: We're the children of Skyrim, and we fight all our lives. And when Sovngarde beckons, every one of us dies!
String.Dest: 我们是天际的子民，我们一辈子都在战斗，只要松加德传来召唤，我们就英勇赴义。

String.Source: But this land is ours and we'll see it wiped clean. Of the scourge that has sullied our hopes and our dreams.
String.Dest: 这片大地是我们的，洁白而干净。任何灾难只会加强我们的信念跟梦想！

String.Source: She may have composed the tune, but her voice doesn't do it justice. Allow me to realize its full potential.
String.Dest: 她已经组成调子了，但她的声音还不够工整。让我来发挥它的全部潜力。

String.Source: Oh, there once was a hero named Ragnar the Red, who came riding to Whiterun from ole Rorikstead!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】哦，曾经有位名叫“红衣拉格纳”的英雄，他从美丽的洛利克镇一路骑马来到白漫城！

String.Source: And the braggart did swagger and brandish his blade, as he told of bold battles and gold he had made!
String.Dest: 大话精吹嘘他身经百战，炫耀着金币还有他的剑。

String.Source: But then he went quiet, did Ragnar the Red, when he met the shield-maiden Matilda who said;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】红衣拉格纳后来变了哑巴，全因他遇到盾牌女仆玛提尔达，她说……

String.Source: Oh, you talk and you lie and you drink all our mead! Now I think it's high time that you lie down and bleed!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】噢，你吹牛喝酒耍活宝！真有种就不要跑！

String.Source: And so then came the clashing and slashing of steel, as the brave lass Matilda charged in full of zeal!
String.Dest: 一阵金属碰撞叮叮当当，勇敢的女孩玛提尔达战意高涨！

String.Source: And the braggart named Ragnar was boastful no more! When his ugly red head rolled around on the floor!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】自大狂拉格纳再也没法在那吹牛了！因为他那丑陋的红毛脑袋掉在地上摔成了一堆渣！

String.Source: Our hero, our hero, claims a warrior's heart! I tell you, I tell you, the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】英雄，英雄，勇者无惧。我告诉你，我告诉你，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: With a Voice wielding power of the ancient Nord art; Believe, believe the Dragornborn comes;
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】诺德技艺，龙吼回归。没错，没错，他是龙裔。

String.Source: It's an end to the evil, of all Skyrim's foes; Beware, beware the Dragonborn comes;
String.Dest: 终结邪恶，敌人的末日。当心，当心，龙裔出世。

String.Source: For the darkness has passed and the legend yet grows; You'll know, you'll know the Dragonborn comes.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】黑暗消逝，传奇之曲正在编织。你会发现，你会发现，龙裔已降临。

String.Source: We drink to our youth, and to days come and gone. For the Age of Aggression is now nearly done.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】为青春干杯，为那些逝去的和将来的日子干杯。因为好战的年代已经结束。

String.Source: We'll drive out the Stormcloaks and restore what we own. With our blood and our steel we will take back our home.
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】我们将驱逐风暴斗篷并恢复我们拥有的一切。用我们的鲜血和武器夺回家园。

String.Source: Down with Ulfric! The killer of kings! On the day of your death, we'll drink and we'll sing!
String.Dest: 【歌词待校对】乌弗瑞克这跳梁小丑！是杀害至高王的凶手！当你终于被湮灭带走，我们会欢唱会喝酒！

String.Source: We're the children of Skyrim, and we fight all our lives. And when Sovngarde beckons, every one of us dies!
String.Dest: 我们是天际的子民，我们一辈子都在战斗，只要松加德传来召唤，我们就英勇赴义。

String.Source: But this land is ours and we'll see it wiped clean. Of the scourge that has sullied our hopes and our dreams.
String.Dest: 这片大地是我们的，洁白而干净。任何灾难只会加强我们的信念跟梦想！

String.Source: Alduin's wings they did darken the sky; His roar fury's fire and his scales sharpened scythes;
String.Dest: 奥杜因其翼遮天蔽日，其吼怒焰四溢，其鳞利如刀锋。

String.Source: Men ran and they cowered and they fought and they died; They burned and they bled as they issued their cries;
String.Dest: 人类退缩、逃跑，战斗、死亡。人类受伤、流血，痛哭、哀嚎。

String.Source: We need saviors to free us from Alduin's rage; Heroes on the field of this new war to wage;
String.Dest: 我们需要救世主将我们从奥杜因的愤怒中解放。这片大地上的英雄们要踏入新的战场上。

String.Source: And if Alduin wins, men is gone from this world; Lost in the shadows of the black wings unfurled;
String.Dest: 奥杜因的胜利，将带来人类的灭亡，黑色双翼的阴影下无处可藏。

String.Source: But then came the Tongues on that terrible day; Steadfast as winter they entered the fray;
String.Dest: 可怕的岁月里，发声者们加入战斗，踏着坚定的步伐，凯歌高奏。

String.Source: And all heard the music of Alduin's doom; The sweet song of Skyrim, sky-shattering Thu'um;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】奥杜因拉下了的命运之幕，那是天际的赞歌，是响彻天际的吐目。

String.Source: And so the Tongues freed us from Alduin's rage; Gave the gift of the Voice, ushered in a new age;
String.Dest: 发声者从奥杜因的愤怒之中解救了我们，龙吼的天赐，引领我们进入新的时代。

String.Source: If Alduin's eternal then eternity's done; For his story is over and the dragons are gone.
String.Dest: 奥杜因的永恒，已然不在。奥杜因的故事，已经终结。龙也消失于天外。

String.Source: Oh, there once was a hero named Ragnar the Red, who came riding to Whiterun from ole Rorikstead!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】哦，曾经有位名叫“红衣拉格纳”的英雄，他从美丽的洛利克镇一路骑马来到白漫城！

String.Source: And the braggart did swagger and brandish his blade, as he told of bold battles and gold he had made!
String.Dest: 大话精吹嘘他身经百战，炫耀着金币还有他的剑。

String.Source: But then he went quiet, did Ragnar the Red, when he met the shield-maiden Matilda who said;
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】红衣拉格纳后来变了哑巴，全因他遇到盾牌女仆玛提尔达，她说……

String.Source: Oh, you talk and you lie and you drink all our mead! Now I think it's high time that you lie down and bleed!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】噢，你吹牛喝酒耍活宝！真有种就不要跑！

String.Source: And so then came the clashing and slashing of steel, as the brave lass Matilda charged in full of zeal!
String.Dest: 一阵金属碰撞叮叮当当，勇敢的女孩玛提尔达战意高涨！

String.Source: And the braggart named Ragnar was boastful no more! When his ugly red head rolled around on the floor!
String.Dest: 【原版歌词替换】自大狂拉格纳再也没法在那吹牛了！因为他那丑陋的红毛脑袋掉在地上摔成了一堆渣！

String.Source: She may have composed the tune, but her voice doesn't do it justice. Allow me to realize its full potential.
String.Dest: 她已经组成调子了，但她的声音还不够工整。让我来发挥它的全部潜力。

String.Source: Snow falls on all the land, all the land, all the land, snow falls on all the land, shrouded by dark wings.
String.Dest: 雪覆大地，雪覆大地，白雪覆盖一切，再由黑翼披上寿衣。

String.Source: A child prayed unto the Gods, save the land, save the land, and the Gods said unto the child, to Skyrim comes spring.
String.Dest: 孺子向神明祷告，求您救救这块土地吧，救救这块土地吧，神明对孩子说，天际之春已踏步而来。

String.Source: For a hero does walk the land, walk the land, walk the land, a hero does walk the land, and the dragons will flee.
String.Dest: 当一个英雄在路上，在路上，在路上，一个英雄在路上，龙就逃跑咯。

String.Source: Flowers bloom on the land, children walk hand in hand, sun shining on white sand, to Skyrim comes peace.
String.Dest: 鲜花盛开在这片土地，孩子们手牵手走在路上，太阳照耀着白色的沙滩，天际迎来了和平。

String.Source: Goodbye.
String.Dest: 再见。

String.Source: Very well.
String.Dest: 很好。

String.Source: Very well.
String.Dest: 很好。

String.Source: All right, then.
String.Dest: 那就这样吧。

String.Source: Speak.
String.Dest: 说。

String.Source: Hm?
String.Dest: 嗯？

String.Source: Make it quick.
String.Dest: 快点好吗？

String.Source: Not many people can find the place, to be honest, since it's not on any map.
String.Dest: 说实话，没多少人能找到这个地方。因为那里在任何一份地图上都没有标示。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: The only reason the guard were able to arrest my father is because he was forced to spend the night in Solitude.
String.Dest: 守卫逮捕我父亲唯一可行的理由就是他非自愿而不得不在独孤城过了一夜。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: We'll duel soon enough! So long as the moons still circle the sky, I will send him to whatever mead hall the Nords reserve for cowards!
String.Dest: 我们很快就会决斗了！只要月亮还呆在天上。我就会把他送到哪个诺德人为懦夫准备的蜜酒馆里！

String.Source: You! You tell that blasted demon to leave this place, and take the skunk on his back with him!
String.Dest: 你！你告诉那个该死的魔鬼赶紧离开这个地方，把那个卑鄙的家伙也带走！

String.Source: I tire of this nonsense, Nord! There's really only one way to settle this, and it isn't with poetry or song!
String.Dest: I tire of this nonsense, Nord! There's really only one way to settle this, and it isn't with poetry or song!

String.Source: {Lute}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴声}

String.Source: {Finish}
String.Dest: {完成}

String.Source: {Lute}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴声}

String.Source: {Lute}
String.Dest: {鲁特琴声}

String.Source: A bench? You wrote a poem about a dilapidated piece of wood? (Laughs) Now that's rich!
String.Dest: 一条长凳？你写了一首关于破木头的诗？ (笑声) 哦太棒了！

String.Source: But enough with the foreplay! Everyone knows a real bard is measured by their musical ability, and I am a dual threat who can play the lute as well!
String.Dest: 但足够的前奏也是重要的！每个人都知道衡量一个真正的吟游诗人的标准是他们的音乐能力, 而且我是个还能弹鲁特琴的双重威胁。

String.Source: Shut up, Nord! I'd like to see you do better!
String.Dest: 闭嘴，诺德人！我希望你能做的更好!

String.Source: The cave is the heart where the dragon tongue sings, and the torchbug pens poetry upon a naked leaf.
String.Dest: 这就是听到龙发出声音的中心位置, and the torchbug pens poetry upon a naked leaf.

String.Source: Here lie seven generations of smells, where beds never cool, and windows never shut their eyes.
String.Dest: 这住了七代人，里面充满了他们的味道，这里的床永远是温暖的，窗户也从不关闭.

String.Source: My dear squire, bid farewell to this hideous monster, for with my words, I will send him to the void.
String.Dest: 我亲爱的老爷，跟这头丑陋的怪物说再见吧，因为我保证，我会把他送进地狱的。

String.Source: Fine. We can flip a coin to see who goes first, but I am feeling generous.
String.Dest: 好. 我们可以丢硬币看谁先来, 但我很大度.

String.Source: I will recite my poem, at which point, you can concede before humiliating yourself further.
String.Dest: 我会反复吟唱我的诗歌，在使你倍受羞辱之前你还是可以让步的。

String.Source: The only thing smitten with you are the fleas, although they'll soon be replaced by fear and overwhelming personal shame.
String.Dest: 唯一被你迷得神魂颠倒的是那堆跳蚤，虽然那些情感很快就会被惊恐和压倒性的羞耻感代替了。

String.Source: And when I have humiliated you to where even living is no longer bearable, the only thing you will have is the maggots that gnaw on your bones.
String.Dest: And when I have humiliated you to where even living is no longer bearable, the only thing you will have is the maggots that gnaw on your bones.

String.Source: So my squire managed to deliver you here after all. I was certain she would've collapsed from the smell.
String.Dest: 毕竟是我的侍从设法把你从这儿就出去的。我很肯定她不会被这种气味搞得崩溃。

String.Source: Are you questioning my methods! It just will! But if you love that Nord so much, bring him here! And I will prove my superiority once and for all!
String.Dest: 你是在质疑我吗!当然会的l! 但如果你足够热爱诺德民族，把他带到这来! 我会只用一次便永远地证明我的优越所在!

String.Source: Your name is unnecessary. I don't wish to humanize my servants. I am your lord, and you are the girl who shines my boots.
String.Dest: 没有给你取名的必要。我可不想教化了我的仆人。我是你的主人，而你只是个帮我擦亮皮靴的姑娘而已。

String.Source: The Nord? You can't be serious. I just told you he was an ignoramus. He will not inspire you.
String.Dest: 那个诺德人？ 你不是认真的吧. 我只是告诉你，他是一个无知的人. 他不会激励你.

String.Source: These books, these bards, and this college will not inspire you. Nor will the Gods.
String.Dest: （若是）这些书，这些吟游诗人以及这个学院都无法影响你，那神也没办法影响你。.

String.Source: If you wish to make great art, then you must cling to my coattails, and clutch at the leftovers I toss away.
String.Dest: 如果你想做好这个伟大的艺术品，那你可得抱好我的大腿，好好把握我施舍给你的丁点儿残渣吧。

String.Source: A student? I'm offended you think anyone would be considered my peer, let alone my superior.
String.Dest: 一个学生？真让我生气你竟然以为谁都能跟我平起平坐，除了我的长辈。

String.Source: The Nord may not be able to form a coherent sentence without the aid of carefully prepared notes, but my tongue is forged in silver.
String.Dest: 如果不借助事先仔细准备好的笔记的话，这个诺德人也许不能条理清晰的说出一句话，但我可是铁齿铜牙啊。

String.Source: My poetry has analogies wrapped inside metaphors, and sewn together in a robe of perfect rhetoric.
String.Dest: 我的诗歌里有很多潜藏在暗喻之下的类比，通过完美的修辞手法结合得天衣无缝。

String.Source: It is a cipher of text where a single line will lead you down a dozen separate paths to enlightenment, depending on how you interpret it.
String.Dest: 这是一个密文，一条线就能引领你到几十个不同路径的启示, 当然这取决于你如何解释它.

String.Source: Excuse me, my lady, but I saw you standing there, and I couldn't help but wonder if you would do me a favor.
String.Dest: 对不起，我的夫人，但我看到你站在那里，我忍不住想，你是否能帮我一个忙。

String.Source: I am in need of an objective opinion on the state of my masterpiece.
String.Dest: 我现在需要的是对我的大师级作品最客观的评价。

String.Source: The other bards have already reached a state of ecstasy upon hearing my verse.
String.Dest: 其他的吟游诗人在听过我的诗后已经神游其中了。

String.Source: Now they treat me with contempt,for I have ruined language itself, as all other words play only sour notes. But your ears are still fresh.
String.Dest: 他们现在对我的态度非常轻蔑，

String.Source: Ataf, your rendition of "Ragnar the Red" is much improved. Someday your song will please Inge's ears, but I'm sure you already please her eyes.
String.Dest: 埃塔夫，你演奏的"红衣拉格纳"已经有很大改进了。总有一天你能愉悦英格的耳朵，而我确信你已经让她一看就觉得赏心悦目了。

String.Source: Alright. The cave is the heart where the dragon tongue sings...no, shouts maybe...
String.Dest: 好吧。这个洞穴就是这里的中心，龙语歌唱的地方……不，也可能是咆哮……

String.Source: I don't have time for the lute. I'm working on a poem. Nay, a masterpiece.
String.Dest: 我没时间去弹那鲁特琴，我正在写一首诗。不仅如此，它将一定是我的最高杰作！我没时间去弹那鲁特琴，我正在写一首诗。不仅如此，它将一定是我的最高杰作！

String.Source: You do have an active imagination Aia. Yet it pales in comparison to your voice. I could drink that in all day.
String.Dest: 你一定非常富有想象力，Aia。虽然跟你的嗓音比起来还是相形见绌。我其实可以喝一整天的酒。
